string.text: You are not allowed here noob, this area is off limits.
Why? What's happening here? Do I need to register my weapons or something?

No. This is the ARENA, if you want to know more, ask our manager. But only VIP's or Duty members can enter, or visitors during performances if they buy a ticket.. For noobs like you, there is a bypass road nearby.
I want to talk about being a VIP.
If you are not a VIP then go ask our manager for details and stop wasting my time!
I have a special VIP card, so open up pal!
Show it to me! Okay, Marked One.. "The Slayer". Seems you are not such a noob as I thought before... it's your lucky day, the door is unlocked, enjoy.
I am a member of Duty now.
Really? Let me check.. yeah, you are on the list. Hmm, a newcomer to Duty and already a VIP, damned Voronin... Okay, anyway, the door is unlocked, you can walk around.
I am not.
I've beaten the best so now what?
Go and speak to the boss, he will give you a pass.
Ok thanks
Can we not come to some sort of an.....arrangement...?
Absolutely not! Well... unless you have 8000 rubles.
Now you're talking my language, here you go.
Well, would you look at that! It seems you are on the list. Sorry for the misunderstanding. Please feel free to pass through here whenever you wish.
Thank you sir!
No, I don't have it.
Well then get out of my sight!
Damn capitalist!

Welcome to ARENA headquarters! I don't remember you being here before. I guess you will be interested to know that this building is not always closed to visitors, only for newcomers.. If you want to know more details, just talk to me, I will give you all the necessary information that will clear your head of the rumors.
Thanks, I will think about it.
I have couple of questions...
Ask, i'm listening.
What is this place?

It's my business in this crazy world. Arena - a place where every stalker can test his skills in a duel with mutants. If this stalker attains enough credit for his skills, he can raise a lot of money. Half a year ago myself and a friend cleared a nest of bloodsuckers. We drove the last, quite mature one, into a house, all exits were closed and we sat and waited. Next thing my mate tells me - "let's have a bet. I will go in and kill him in 2 minutes or less". He entered the house and did it. This gave me the idea of ARENA. We made a deal with Duty, took this hangar and made converted it into an arena. So now we have our own business in the Zone.
Where do these mutants come from?

We have a deal with Duty. Before, they used to kill all of them, and then I suggested money in exchange for the injured or weak ones. They quickly agreed and ever since then we have an almost unlimited source of living mutants. And I'm even stuffing the dead beasts corpses and selling them outside the Zone. It's very popular now.
Where are you from?

Lot's of places. I'm not even sure any more what to call my homeland. I spent a long time in Africa, then few years in Equador. Then I heard about a wonderfull place and heard that I can get lot's of riches there.
No more questions.
What are the rules?

Oh, the rules, they are quite simple. I figured them out myself. There is a cell in which we place a mutant. You pay money, and you choose the time in which you will kill this beast. If you are lucky - there is a reward. If not - I keep the money for myself. If you die - I promised to bury you with full honors. The shorter the time you choose - the larger the reward will be. You can also get extra bonuses if you become number 1.
Which one?
A free passage through arena during day light, we have a strong security here to keep out idiots and dumbasses. Just to keep this place safer.
I want to fight. Which beast do you have available at the moment?
Nobody to fight for now. Come back here later, when the next Duty mutant raid returns.
We have 2 dogs. Quite ugly and big beasts, pretty well beaten. Also angry, like my mother-in-law.
I will try. Let these dogs out.
Nah, I wont fight with a dog.
Now, give me the money for participating. 1000 rubles please.
Here are your 1000 rubles
I don't have enough money.
Too bad, come back again when you're a little more flush...
We have quite a fluffy and scratchy pseudodog at the moment. Not sure how Duty captured it, because this beast is real crazy, I'm surprised they all survived the capture.
Let's play with this pseudodog.
Nah, I wont fight with it.
Now, give me the money for participating. 1500 rubles please.
Here are your 1500 rubles
This cost is too high for me.
Beggar... I think then it's time for you to leave.
Aw, little girl scared by a little doggie? Okay, don't cry...
Good. Now you should choose the time in which you will kill the mutant. If you succeed you win the reward, if not I keep the fee. Remember, the shorter the time you choose, the bigger the reward.
10 seconds, double the prize.
30 seconds, you will win half of the bet.
1 minute. You will win a fifth of the bet.
I changed my mind.
20 seconds, double the prize.
40 seconds, you will win half of the bet.
Damn, I had a better opinion about you... I'm not refunding your money!
Bet accepted, you have only 10 seconds. The official part is over. Welcome to ARENA.
Bet accepted. Official part over. Welcome to arena.
Bet accepted, you have a minute. Official part over. Welcome to arena.
Bet accepted, you have 20 seconds as a beginner. Official part over. Welcome to arena.
A freak in a gasmask. People call them "snorks". Skinny and weak at first glance, but nimble and quick like Jackie Chan. I saw some of his movies when I was a kid....
Give me this snork.
For you, 2000 rubles to try.
Here are your 2000 rubles.
Sorry. I don't enough have money.
Beggars in the Zone.. what is this place coming to?
Nah, I don't want to fight with a snork.
You scared that this half rotted freak in a gasmask would make you look bad?
At this time it's a real luck. We captured a young bloodsucker. He is still a bit naive, but already a worthy opponent.
Okey, get this bloodsucker ready.
3000 rubles entry fee and I'll ready the bloodsucker.
Here is your money.
I don't have that much.
Oh shit, even my son has this kinda money, and he is still a child!
Nah, I don't want to fight a bloodsucker.
Aha! You are frightened. As I thought...

At this time we have a small gnome like creature in a black cloak - burer they are called. It was really lucky that Duty got him. He almost took down the whole squad before they wrangled this bastard.
Get this freak ready for action!
Not so fast. First pay me the 5000 ruble entrance fee.
Here is your money.
I don't have enough right now.
If you are so poor, then get lost!
Nah, I don't want to fight with a burer.
He is half of your size man, why are you so afraid of him?

Oh, this is special case. Not sure how they captured him, but he is a real monster! To everyone, his name is "Beast". If you will beat this bastard i will give you a special VIP-card so you can get around there anytime you want. So, do we have a deal?
Agreed. Give me that "Beast".
Ok, if you agree, pay me 5000 rubles.
Here are your 5000 rubles.
I don't have enough money.
Even stalkers are poor now... Good times we live in...
Nope, Beast is too much for me.
Actually, even I fear this beast, so I don't blame you.
I am here about the last fight.
Hello! We have a new beast here. Wanna try your skills on it?
So, what are you waiting for? Come on, go through this cell door to your destiny.
Sorry, nobody to fight for now. Wait a day or so until we get another mutant delivery.
Well done! Here is your reward. If you ever want to fight for more money, just come back here.
Sorry brother, you lost. Come back and try next time if you want.
We don't have any new beasts yet, come back later.
Hey, Marked One! You've got something for me?
Ratcatcher; you wanted me to help him, right? Well, here's the alibi needed so that the Military will let him off the hook.

Great work! Fast, clean service. We could use a guy like you around here. Apparently you're looking for that Strelok fellow, am I right? How about you work for us some more? You never know what might pop up about him. World's a small place, I can guarantee you that.
Sure, but no suicide missions. Am I clear?

OK stalker, I've got something for you then; still high risk, but take it or leave it. There's some boys down in the Dark Valley, at the old stables, and they need help with dealing with the local dime-a-dozen cultists – the Monolith goons. They've managed to not get killed by both thugs and fanatics, so they must be doing something right. Maybe you already know since you're involved with Sid, but we traders are interested in learning a route to Pripyat and the NPP, pass the dreaded Brain Scorcher. Apart from this Man of Myth – the so-called "Guide" – nobody is said to have been there and lived to tell the tale.
There's something related to the labs in the Dark Valley?

Apparently so... Best bet is that the Monolithians got it under their control. I'm not that informed about it. Colonel Petrenko knows best. Go talk to him, he's in the back room. He's deeply invested in this sort of research, mainly because it might lead to these Sin guys he hates so much.
Let me back there, I'll talk to him myself.
I wanted to ask...
Yes?
Sid told me someone knows about "transmutation" here, and about the device for advanced stalkers.

I do. They are using it to merge artefacts which sometimes produces more positive effect for stalkers. I recommend you visit our local scientist at Yantar. He is deals with that kind of stuff and can give you more information. Please don't mention him that I told you this though.
Sure, thanks.
You're Colonel Petrenko, aren't you?

Ah, so you're that guy Sidorovich has been playing around with. Fresh from a Death Truck too, how golden. The name is Petrenko – Colonel of Duty, second-in-command of General Voronin. Nice to meet you stalker.
Nice to meet you too. Now, what's with this whole business in the Dark Valley?

Simply put, we've had some stalker boys telling us some intriguing things about Monolith activities. Apparently there's a lab named X18 under their base. I'm not sure what exactly is buried under there, but neither do the Monolith. They can't open it yet, or maybe they don't want to. The information is pretty sketchy.
And you want in?

Exactly. Whatever is in those labs will attract... the Sins – those damn aberrations. Go to the old barn, the mates over there have a pretty solid plan. Bring me whatever you can find after your digging, and I'll reward you handsomely. Any bit of info, however small, can be crucial.
Really? Sounds like old crap to me.

Just think about it for a second: the old experiments back in the day were pretty extensive and could provide the backbone for new ones. That kind of information can be a great bargaining chip for Duty, and Sin will surely show themselves to gather it. One other thing, some people have come back from these underground labs saying they heard voices, or even seen ghosts from the past! This has driven some people mad, but you may learn something, if you don't shit your pants first, ha!
OK, I'll go see them and we will talk later.
Colonel, I've got some documents for you from X18.

Hmm... that's interesting. There are some things I already know in there, but there's new details. Voronin will be interested in those I'm sure. There is also one encrypted file which I can't open with my current equipment. But anyways, the file header indicates it has something to do with the X18 bosses... Anyways, good job stalker.
Damn, that Strelok sure loves anonymity. Well, now at least I have new leads.
I discovered an old encryption system here, which they used in all labs from what I found. The last global password change was to "top_secret". Maybe you can dig in further if you like.
Thanks.
By the way, here are the other docs I found in X18.
Thanks, you have outdone yourself stalker!
Sure, no problem.
Seems we meet again, Colonel.
Well, well, you have quite a reputation amongst Duty now, going on a Bloodsucker hunt all by yourself like that. You big damn hero!
Yeah...well...don't believe everything you read in the papers.

Don't be shy, you'll get used to the fame in due time. Anyway, we received word from Dima about your little "deal". You did good Marked One. Hell, maybe even better that my best men. The Ecologists are filtering out the deadly gases from our base in the factory as we speak. It's sad that so many were killed by those damn Bloodsuckers... I've got to warn you before I give you the key to the lab underneath Rostok: there's a sort of "Bloodsucker King" down there. That's why we sealed it off in the first place - it's a damn nest! If you're really going down there, drag that ugly bastard to Hell for me, will you? Here's the key then. They're all yours, stalker.
I've probably pissed him off by killing his children. Might as well finish the job.
Hey, about that Bloodsucker King...
Yeah?
Maybe we should name him Dracula or something?
(I wonder why he's giving me that look...?)
Problem with "Dracula" solved.
Yeah? Did you kill him?
Yes! I think i finished him
Great! Good job, stalker!
Thanks.
I want to discuss the docs.
What documents? And what do you want to discuss?
Sidorovich sent me to search the old facility in the Forest. That's everything I've found there.
Sidorovich sent me to search the old facility in the Forest.
And how is the search doing?
I'm working on it but I need some more time.
I came to tell you that I won't be doing this anymore.
Are you sure? This is not urgent: you can do it later.
Really? Well, I could actually continue searching if you're not in a hurry.
Great, I'm waiting for the results, but don't keep it on back burner!
Yes, I'm sure, I won't be doing it.
Alright then, I won't try to make you do it. Abort that.
Show me what you've got. Wow, that's a big pile of papers! Let me take a quick look... there's something about the old entrance to the X-18. Have you already been to that place?
No, but I can pay it a visit - I know where it's located.
Then look there and then we'll think what to do with that information. Go now, and I need to think some more about that.
Yes, I'd read it through and decided to check there too; I found a whole journal.
You're fast! Well, Marked One, great work... for which I can pay double! Sin doesn't even know about these documents, so that'll help us in the negotiations and stuff.
And what's there in these papers?

The only thing clear is that nothing's clear. This is very complicated and vague. I can't tell you anything specific. But that's our leverage over the Sin, and that's exactly what we need. According to the records, experiments got out of control fast, that's why they couldn't clean up the mess and destroy the notes. Or decided that nobody will look for that in the Zone. Anyway, I want you to find some more docs for me. You should look for it at Lake Yantar.\n\nYantar is full of mystery and there are so many mutants that not everyone can get there. So there aren't many willing. And those eggheads are always looking for people to clear out the local hangars and basements. There may be some docs. Get there and take everything that you'll find. But first talk to Sakharov, he'll help.
Alright. These papers again... when will it all end?
No, I have no desire to go there. I've already ran through it. I don't think there's anything there left.
Yeah, you're right. Well, we already have enough. It'll come in handy. Take your reward.
Show me what you've got. Yes, interesting papers. Let me take a quick look... nothing to work with, sadly. Are you sure you'd found everything?
Hmm, I can look for some more, if necessary.
Yeah, you'd better do that: there may be something left - though I'm not sure about that.
Yes, I had looked it through. Every corner. So much time has passed: no way something is still remaining.

Show me what you got. Yes, interesting papers. Let me take a quick look... nothing to work with, sadly. Although, there's something about the old entrance to the X-18. Have you already been to that place?
I'm here to talk about the old entrance to the X-18.
I'm listening.
Nothing found yet, but I'll continue the search.
I've been there and found some journal. Very interesting stuff!
Let me know if you find something.
Hi, Barkeep, I have a business matter.
Well, business is always good.
Sid told me about the docs, but he said that he quit the case. Do you know something about that?
Well, of course. I'd mind my own business, but I'm safe under Duty's protection.
Cut to the chase.

You'll have to get to another place and look there: it's deserted and dangerous, stalkers are a rare sight there. You know, the Zone often "freezes" the places, like stopping the time there. That's why many are left untouched, stay in one condition for fifteen to twenty years. I'm sure there's something left. Go look there.
Well, that's good, but what place are you talking about?
That's a mine or something like that; located In the Forest, to the north of the Dark Valley. I've even heard that the scientists were experimenting on the rocks there.
Yeah, very interesting. Well, I'll look into that.
And don't take your findings to me, go straight to Petrenko. He'll be glad and he will pay you.
I want to discuss the Yantar documents.
And I already thought you've forgotten about them... did you bring them?
Yes, all the documents from Yantar - take them. I've digged everywhere - there's nothing more to look for.

Great! Now let me look through them. It seems that someone seriously miscalculated and did not pay enough attention to safety...

I knew it was a thing!.. even I have goosebumps reading this. And this, this... well, complete sloppiness! But still not fully clear.

Listen, it would be a huge understatement to say you helped Duty; you simply saved us! Here's your reward... and Duty owes you now!
That's good to know! And a reward won't miss me.
You got all the documents?
I only found these, and there's nothing more to look for.
So, let's see what you have there... the most important is missing! We must look further.
Well, I'll continue the search: perhaps I hadn't noticed something...
Okay, I'm waiting. But you better hurry up!
Sorry, but I only found what I brought. There's nothing more there.
Listen, it would be a huge understatement to say you helped Duty; you simply saved us! What kind of reward do you want: an outfit, or a gun?
An outfit would be fine.
Here's a great outfit for you - we used to give these to our recruits.
A gun. Does any ammo go along with it?
Certainly! Here's your new weapon and some ammo for it.
So, how's the search going?
I refuse to look for these documents - not interested. Besides, it's too difficult.
Understandable. Well, thank you for what you've brought anyway; Duty owes you a massive favor now! Here's your reward for the effort.
I received your call for help, what can I do?

Thanks for coming, Marked One. We've been caught off-guard by this attack. Damn these mercs; they've gotten the big stuff out! Is this retribution?! Anyways, Arnold was up on the water tower with the RPG, but he bit the dust. Please, take the choppers down while we hold them here! I'll mark his last position on the map – the RPG is all yours.
I'll get right on it!
The helis are destroyed.

Stalker, we can't thank you enough! My men and I will stay and clean things up and hopefully re-open the bar soon. We locked it down when the mercs attacked. I`ve unlocked the door now and will start refurbishments right away.
I see, well, glad I could help out. So, what happened to Voronin and Barman?

With the help of our best soldiers, Barman and Voronin were escorted to the Outskirts of Pripyat. They've set up a new Stalker Bar there. You should go there and meet up with them – there are some problems in the Outskirts, as you'll see. Oh, by the way: I think I know how to thank you! If you go towards the Bar, you'll get into that house... There is a door - we used to hide something behind it... Anyway, it's open now - and you can grab everything what's in there!
Yeah, thanks for that. I'll leave right away.
About the helis.
Hey Stalker, how is it going out there?
I'm out of rockets; do you have any?
Take these, they're all we have left.
Let's hope it's enough.
I'm working on it.
Hey stalker, we have a problem here. Interested in doing our group a little favour?
Sure, tell me about it.

Here is the deal: we are group of newcomers who are trying to reach the 100 Rads Bar, but a bunch of Pseudodogs are nesting near the Bar entrance and are blocking the way. If you can help us, I will share some loot with you. I've sent you the PDA coordinates, just in case. Good luck!
Sorry, another time.
Don't worry, we are not going anywhere... maybe you will have a heart and change your mind sometime.
OK.
Any progress in killing all those mangy mutts?
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
Eliminated. You can walk through.
Thank you, stalker. Some of us already wanted to return to Garbage, but you saved us! By the way, here is a reward. We hope you'll find plenty of artifacts in the future!

Y'know, we decided to stay here for now. It's quite a comfortable place for trading – lots of stalkers and Duty guys pass by, so we can gather what we need. Maybe later we will move out to a better place. Though your efforts weren't for nothing; at least you helped all the other Stalkers who will come to Bar in the near future.
Hello, Marked One. My name is Snitch and I know many things – little stories that may rouse your interest. Wanna know something interesting about the Zone?
500 rubles.

A while ago, a group of stalkers attempted to reach the center of the Zone, right through the Brain Scorcher. As you must know, the path to Pripyat and beyond is covered with deadly psy-emissions that makes your brain boil – turning humans into a soulless beasts. However, it is said that the group marched on and disappeared. Hearsay among expert stalkers is that members of the group returned, but no one really knows how they did. No one really knows if this even happened, though it makes you wonder...
1000 rubles.

You know the bandit base in the Dark Valley? They keep all their stuff in the underground storage, though it is heavy guarded. If someone is crazy enough to rob them, then he could sell their supplies to Barkeep and get some good money out of it.
1500 rubles.

Scientists in Yantar always need body parts of mutants for their experiments – they pay with hard cash and they've got plenty of it, so you can bring in as much as you want. They also seek out willing stalkers for field experiments with animals and anomalies. Their assistants get to access their advanced eco suits – quite useful to survive heavily radiated areas and deadly anomalies, even psy-emissions fields. It could be useful in places such as the Radar, Lost Factory or beyond that. Don't go thinking it makes you immune to the Scorcher though...
2000 rubles.

There's a place called North Hills past Radar. It's rumoured that there is a stash there that is beyond what anyone could imagine. Apparently it requires a leap of faith, whatever that means. They say you can find it on the “W.C. island” and you'll know when you see it... It is also rumoured that a map to this 'wonder stash' is hidden in the forest somewhere in a humongous anomaly formation.
Do you have enough money?
Yes.
No, sorry.
Return when you have some cash.
Do you have anything else?
I'm sorry, Marked One, but I don't have any more info for your right now. Come back later.
1000 rubles.

I've heard there is something hidden in a code locked place that could be of huge value put in the right hands. Rumour is that the code to the door was written down on a piece of paper and torn in half. Apparently there is some loner mad scientist in the North Hills who has one half. Not sure how true it is.

Greetings. I'm Voronin, leader of Duty. Please, have a look around, but do not trouble us. We don't like drunkards and rowdys, so don't even think about firing a weapon in here, unless you want to meet your maker.
I want to join Duty forces.
It's not that simple. To join us as an outsider, you will need to do one important job for us.
What I have to do?

I need to send this delivery to one of our squadron officers near the Rostok Factory; they are having troubles there, and are in desperate need of supplies. Deliver them without a hitch, without stealing anything, and for me it will be enough to trust you. Can you do that for us?
Of course, I will be back soon.
I need to think about it.
So, can I join Duty?
You finished the task?
Yes.
Good job! Now you just need to make monetary investment. 5000 rubles.
I have money.
Now, you need to take the Duty oath. Repeat after me.
Let's do it.

"I am stately swear to protect my country against the Zone and any stalker which would like to help our goal. I'll never go against the moral code and stop everyone who will join our enemies and support living of this abormination! We are Duty, Zone must be stopped and only we can do it! hurrah!"
I am stately swear to protect my country against the Zone...

Perfect. Now you are officially a member of Duty. As a beginner, you won't get too much - just a basic outfit and the honor that comes from being a member of Duty. Your commander is me for this time, but if any of our guys ask for help, never refuse. One for all and all for one!
I'm glad to be part of Duty.
I've changed my mind, it's too much for me, sorry. See you later.
Not yet.
Hurry up, I won't wait forever.
So, can you make a monetary investment now? 5000 rubles.
Do you have any job for me?
Finish this first.

I've got your first official task. You can prove your worth to us by helping our recon group which is currently at Lake Yantar. We sent a messenger to them, but we have had no news from him for 2 whole days. Something happened, so now we are sending you. Your task is to figure out the current situation at the camp and assist them with whatever they need. Also try to find the missing messenger and bring me his badge. Can you deal with it, soldier?
Of course, General! I'll do it.
Don't let us down, we are counting on you.
I need time to think about it. I'll be back later.
Don't put it under carpet for too long, soldier. Our guys may be in danger.
I am here about my task.

Well done, soldier. Not only did you figure out what was going on, but you also returned the badge of our messenger. He was a good man, we will miss him. I will send this back to his relatives back in Moscow so they may grieve properly... And you, soldier, from this impressive showcase of skills and knowhow, I promote you to the rank of Junior Sergeant! You get your reward and also access to our armory for a special shooter. Talk to Ivancov, he will give you a proper one.

Nice job, soldier. You figured out the problem and wiped the floor with those bandits... However, you didn't find our messenger? Not even a badge? I assumed the poor lad died out there and wanted to give something to his family... no? Well, anyway, you did your job, soldier. From this moment on, you are a Junior Sergeant! Please continue to work with this dedication.
Yo, Marked One. Interesting day, right? Lot's of new faces, fresh beer, blood and puke stains in the corners - and idiots sneaking around, not knowing what's good for them...
You're not much of a people person I see.

I can't say that I really hate them... But sometimes, when they start asking stupid questions or pester me for favors, I'd massacre them with a battle axe. Let's end this useless chitchat and go straight to business, if you don't' mind. You have some reason to be here... right?
Tell me about yourself.
Really. Really? Really... You are telling me that you are genuinely interested in a bored, fat guy on guard duty? O-kay bucko, what you wanna know?
How did you get here?
What are you selling?
How good are you at upgrading weapons?

It's a long story. Before I got here, I was just an ordinary lazy coder and webmaster for some game company... Hmm, what was the name... ah... can't remember. We had some success with a couple of post-apocalyptic shooters, then our boss went mad and fired all of us and went off to some Caribbean island... Something like that. I had no idea how to continue earning the daily bread for my big family without working 2-3 part-time jobs. And then, as you already know, the Zone appeared, lots of newbies wanted to find some meaning in their lives and some profit as well. So why should I stay away from modern trends? As the result, I dug up an old pistol that my grandfather left to me, bought ammo for it, took some money I had stashed, and came here. I learned how to maintain weapons and gear, upgrading and tweaking them, selling them in bulk... So here I am, managing the armory, sending big checks back home for my wife and kids. That's my story.

I sell many things, rare weapons which you won't find anywhere else, but it's all for Duty members. If you want to get some pieces of this golden mine, you need to join Duty first. Weapons from the armory is forbidden for our ordinary soldiers though, you need to be given a high rank.

Good enough that Duty didn't ask for a contribution when I wanted to join. I have some natural talent, but my mentor taught me everything. He was a strange guy, wore glasses, very focused on his work, kind of weird. When he heard my story, he taught me the fundamentals about weapons, then moved on to something else when he got bored of me. I've tried finding him, but the nickname he used when teaching me was most definitely a fake. It's scary to think that he only taught me one-fifth of his knowledge... He has to be a university graduate for sure...
Voronin sent me. He said you had a special gift.
Yeah, I already prepared a nice gun for you. Seems like you proved yourself to get this. Here, take it.
[Take it]

Modified MP5A4 with fixed buttstock created by Heckler and Koch in 1966. It has built-in sight, has big magazine to stuff your enemies with lead, light weight and comfortable to use for secret recon operations. Have fun with it...
Thanks, bye.

Listen my friend, for now we have a quite complicated task for you... As you know, we are in a state of war with Freedom. Their ideals are a threat to our mission, and they are a very resourceful foe. That's why I want to keep an eye on them. I need you to take this bug and get through to their base in the Outskirts and place it on the window sill as you enter bar on the left. Any information that we can get from this will help us get rid of these buffoons. I will send a password to your PDA. You will need this to pass their guard. The Swamp is blocked by Military for now, so I asked a guide to escort you and bypass the usual paths to go there. He is waiting for you. Oh, and I suggest you don't wear your uniform, they won't appreciate it. While you are there, snoop around the bar and see if you can get any other intelligence or items that may be useful.
Just call me 007.
Try to be a little more discreet than a Hollywood blockbuster though. Good luck.
I'm here about the bug.
Did you plant it?
Not yet, I'm working on it.
Hurry up, they change the password about every week or so.
All done, I got a flash drive and set the bug.

Hah, you did it! Good job Sergeant, now it will be easier for us to figure out what's going on in their "secret chambers". You proved yourself worthy to us, and even more! You acted like a true professional by infiltrating enemy lines and getting us important intelligence. For that, I am giving you a position of Lieutenant and also a special present! Go and see Ivancov on the roof.
All done, but I had to kill all of them.

Sergeant, you acted without any tact. Even by killing all of them, there are twice punks waiting to take their place. Didn't you think about it? The long-term benefits would've eclipsed what you did. At least you got a flashdrive with some intelligence info in case they try to strike back. For that, I am giving you a position of Lieutenant. Now, dismissed!
All done, but I killed everyone and didn't get any intelligence.

Sergeant! How could you be this sloppy and hotheaded?! You just murdered them all and completely disregarded my orders! What will we do now?! We'll have a full-on war with the rest of these punks brandishing Lukash as their martyr! And we've got to intelligence to counter that! Marked One, you're hereby dismissed from Duty in shame! Take your money and leave me at once!
All done... but I had to return the flash drive - they'd spotted me. The good thing is, they hadn't noticed the bug and I managed to get out freely.

Yeah, these are not the results I've been waiting for... at least the op went successfully. Anyway, you passed, sergeant: now it will be easier for us to figure out what's going on in their "secret chambers".
All done: the bug is set... but I completely forgot about the other intelligence. I'll get back there and get it.
Hi mate. Voronin said you have something special for me.
Yeah, of course, I already cleaned up this toy especially for you. I am sure you will like it.

OC-14-4A "Groza-4" bullpup assault rifle which uses 9x39mm special rounds. It was designed by TsKIB SOO in Russia and has quite good accuracy characteristics. You can create a hole into anyone even from a distance of 200 metres. Hard weapon for hard guys like you. It also supports addons like a grenade launcher the all the good stuff. I improved some properties, so it's modified into a, how should I say... uber-killing weapon.
Thanks again, bye.

Good day, Lieutenant. Want to drink something? Or you're interested in another dirty job? OK then, listen... We sent a squad to a Construction Site road almost 5 days ago, but we haven't had a sitrep since. I guess their radio signal isn't getting through from their position. I need you to figure out what happened to our strike team. The reason I sent them there was to investigate a rumors about some strange new species of mutants, and document anything about such a species. Are you ready to go look into the secrets of this area?
Of course, I will find them.
Right then, good luck Lieutenant.
I'm here about the raid group.
Did you help them out?
Not yet.
Don't slack off, they're relying on you. Go go go!
Yes, I did.

Wow, Lieutenant, just wow. That had to be rough, but you did it with honor. Not only did you save our strike team, but also another one near the pump station, and we got the information we needed about this new mutant. Looks like it was born from the Burers coming in contact with the radioactive mucus of the lake's water. We should warn the scientists and stalkers to stay far from it. And you, my friend, for your incredible service to our cause, attain the highest rank of our group - Major! From now, all Duty groups need to respect you and act accordingly. Ivancov has some sort of "ultimate weapon" for you, which will win you every battle you partake in. Be proud, Major!

Not bad Lieutenant, not bad... At least half of our team is alive, and you did your mission as expected. However, our guys who researched the new mutants died, and the bulk of their observations were lost. We will need to consult the Ecologists about what we should do next... And you, my friend, for your honorable service to our cause, attain the highest rank of our group - Major! Here is your reward for your help.

Lieutenant, I'm sad to admit it, but you failed us... Too many good soldiers died there, and for what? We even didn't get any information about the strange mutants, only your words, and that's not enough. We needed scientific data, which only our group could produce... Despite your service to our cause, I must discharge you from Duty for this failure. I will give you money for your troubles, but I think from this moment on our roads must diverge.
I'm afraid most of your men are dead...
Thanks, I appreciate it.

Yes, my friend, do you want to deal with Sin? I guess you know they are quite severe guys and trouble us often. They extorted from us valuable information which we need to take back. Petrenko doesn't like it one bit, but their boss suggested a solution to us: they will send a negotiator who will propose their terms for a possible agreement. If we agree to them, they will give us back our valuable information. Can you figure it out, Sergeant, and become our spokesman?
Of course, I will shake out it from him.
Go luck Sergeant, and let your goal light up your way.
It was a hell of a job, but I did it.

Exceptional Major! You not only got what we needed, but also helped us to give Sin a false sense of security! You've earned my praise, I am proud of you. And for that, I bestow upon you a special weapon! Ivancov is waiting for you. By the way, Sid said the Ecos in Yantar need help with something, go see if you can help them.

Well, you got rid of Sin for good... But what will the others think of us as negotiators? You didn't end talks with this guy peacefully. You could've tried harder... At least we got the information that was lost. Here is your reward. By the way, Sid said the Ecos in Yantar need help with something, go see if you can help them.

You failed me, Major. We got only parts of the stolen information. How can we stay here now that our positions are compromised? All that because of your inability to negotiate with anybody except yourself. You can't stay in Duty with such sloppy results. I will pay you, but it's not the result I expected out of you. Sid said the Ecos in Yantar need help, go and see if you can do any better for them.
Sorry, I don't know how it went wrong.
Seems like you still have work to do with the Dark stalkers!
Yes, ok, I'm on it.
Thanks, I tried my best.
Not now my friend. Duty has no troubles as of now, and we have you to thank for that, Major!
So... I`m back for another gift.
You really are some insane do-all killer robot, aren't you...
Really now...

Yeah... You are like the Terminator. Maybe you're even some cyborg sent by NATO to clean up the Zone. Or maybe his is all a VR experiment and I'm just some NPC you're talking to. I don't know, the point is that you're scary...
I asure you that I'm as normal as you... OK, bad example, but you know what I mean.
Sureee.... Hey, at least I can hand you another cool weapon for all your troubles. Here it is, take it! C'mon!
[Take it]

Here we go... I present to you the RG-6 developed by TsKIB SOO, also known as 6G-30 - multi-shot and fast grenade launcher specially built for heavy targets like military outposts, high-ground bunkers and even tanks! It fires 40mm grenades and has a six-shot cylinder. This lil' bitch will turn any dumb bastard into a fried piece of meat. Take care of it and have fun!
I will. Thanks mate.
I've helped you enough, but I have to continue my way alone.
Well, I respect your choice. Thank you for everything you've done for "Duty".
I need a serious job; do you have something for me?
Hmm, yeah, there's one... special job, so to speak. But it's only for thore who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty.
I can't remember the last time mine were clean...

Then listen. There are reports that our posts on the Rostok Factory and in the Forest have been scouted by bandits - even pictures may have been taken. And we don't like a bit of that. Your task is to eliminate these scouts and take all the storage devices. Don't forget about smaller ones such as USB sticks and memory cards.
Where can I find these bandits?

We know more about the bandits than they know about us: their numbers, location - we have all of that. I'll mark their current position in your PDA. Once you've got there, take care of their snipers and then get rid of the rest. Don't forget about their leader - you'll probably find the data in his den.
Got it! Kill the bandits, collect all storage devices and bring them here. But why don't you deal with them yourself?

Because the info saying we've been scouted can be wrong: we don't want to attack the bandits in the open - but a lonely stalker won't be that suspicious and won't leave any track. Either way, I'm waiting for the results.
Alright, I'll deal with them.
I've brought you all the stuff, and the bandits are dead.
Yes, my lads reported me that there was gunfire at the place.
Did they tell you anything about mercenaries?
The mercs? No, and what about the mercs?

It appeared that bandits really did scout your posts. When I grabbed everything, mercenaries appeared, six men. They ordered the scouting, but I have no idea why. I gave them nothing and fought my way out.
That's not good news at all, the last thing we need is a confrontation with the mercenaries! But at least they didn't get any information.
These mercs are getting annoying, and it's time to do something about this.
Here, take all the stuff I've found.
Nice job, and I didn't forget about your reward.
I've taken care of the bandits and found all the storage devices, but there was an issue...
Yes, my lads reported me that there was gunfire at the place. What issue?

It appeared that bandits really did scout your posts. When I grabbed everything, mercenaries appeared, six men. They ordered the scouting, but I have no idea why. It wasn't going to be a fair fight, so I had to give them all the data. Though they didn't let me go in peace, despite their promises.
That's highly disturbing news. I don't even know what that means. Alright, although you couldn't fulfill your mission, at least you've got rid of the bandits. So here's your reward.
I did all I could.
I know. You aren't a Duty member and don't have to risk your life for our sake. Here's your reward.
Can I help you stalker?
It's my first time here. Could you tell me a little about this place?

Before the accident in '86 this was an industrial area. As you can see, there ain't much left of it now... In the basement by the hangar you'll find the 100 Rads bar. The place is run by the local trader who doubles up as a barman. If you want to trade, talk, get a mission or find out the latest news, that's the place to go. There's also the Arena where you can fight and make some cash. Duty's base is not far from the Arena. If you want to join Duty go straight over there - they'll tell you who to speak to. Oh, by the way, all of this area is protected by Duty so behave and keep your weapons holstered. If you start shooting, the patrol will "calm you down" pretty quickly.
You said there's a bar here. Can you tell me where exactly it is?
In the basement behind the hangar...I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks.
You said the Duty base is here. How do I get to it?
It's not far from the Arena. I've marked it on the map for you.
Thanks.
You said there's an Arena here? Where exactly is it?
Go out of the hangar with the broken roof and you'll end up right in front of it. I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks for the information.
Thanks again for all the information.
Please, can you help me?
What is the problem?

I'm so embarrassed! I was returning from the Construction Site when some bandits had mugged me: they took my prized possession, my rifle. I'm too scared to go and get it, so please help me. I'll try to make it worth your while.
Sure, I'll get it back for you.
Sorry, I have more pressing matters to attend to.
About your weapon
Did you get it?
Not yet, I'll have it soon.
Yes, here it is.
Wow, thanks very much, you don't know what it means to me. Here is a reward for your trouble.
Thanks man, take care.
Hello, soldier.
Hey. What do you need?
Can you help me with something?
Sure, go on.
Have you met Garik?
Yes, of course: we've been comrades for a long time. Has anything happened?
I'm looking for him: he's missing and there's no news about him. Do you know something about it?
Well, he's a pioneer: always looking for something, exploring. Why do you even care?
I found his PDA and would want to return it... if that's still possible.
Last time I've seen him, he was going to Pripyat underground. Look for him there... if you can get there, of course.
Good, thanks a lot.
Hey. So you are the local technician? I need some things to be fixed.
Whoa, not so fast, stalker! The rules are different here: I can only deal with the Duty members' equipment... or our good friends', at the very least.
Is there any way to become such "friend"?
I'm not the one to come up with the rules but you usually need to help the faction; we'll talk once you've proved yourself... but again, I'm not the one to decide.
I see. Well, thank you anyway.
Of course, Marked One! People like you are always welcome here. I will repair or upgrade your equipment if you want me to.
I'm here to repair a few things of mine.
Didn't I tell you only our members and friends are welcome here? Since you are neither, no way I can help you.
Yeah, I've already heard you helped our guys at the Factory and killed the beasts underground as well. I can repair your equipment if you want me to.

Hey Marked One! I've already heard about the Bar showdown. That's impressing! Now I can repair or even upgrade your equipment if you want me to... unless you need some hi-end upgrades. But if you really need some, talk to Petrenko - he has some special missions for you.

Yeah, I've already heard you helped our guys at the Factory and about the Bar showdown. That's impressing! Now I can repair or even upgrade your equipment if you want me to... unless you need some hi-end upgrades. But if you really need some, talk to Petrenko - he has some special missions for you.
Barkeep, I really need your help.
What happened, loner?
I've been looking for any info about Garik for a long time already - though I'm not even sure if it's a name or nickname.
You don't mean my bodyguard, right? Well, of course I know Garik; how could I not? Every trader does: the guy brings many artifacts, never haggles. Has something happened to him?
He's missing - which often happens here. I was asked to find him, or at least his body.
Hi there... (clears throat) Iiiiiis Boris!
Dude, no need to yell, I'm right in front of you... So, what are you doing here at the trashcans? Tourist Delight not serving you well? Or did Barman suddenly forbid serving gopniks?
Oy blin, as if you're a prophet! I suppose mixing Pripyat Beer, vodka, wine, Tourist Delight and peanuts ain't the best idea... Oy mama...
My condolences. But what kind of slav are you then if you can't hold such a molotov coctail in?
Ey, ey! Look at this stance! Heels flat on the ground, not like some amerikanski shpion! Adidas tracksuit? Check. Makarov? Check!
Okay, okay, bratan, keep calm. I never seen you here before, where the hell did you come from?

Estonia, brat. The economy in my town went pizdec, so I went nahui and landed here, in the slav promised land. Now I'm free to squat everywhere, and whenever I want! And the economy is simple - do job, get money, buy slightly irradiated and past-expiry-date food! Nothing babushkas recipes won't fix!
Well damn, you sure feel at home here. Well, get better comrade, I have to go.
Sure thing! When I get better, I will start my mission of teaching the slav ways to all people who either forgot them, or are too stuborn to accept them. Stay cheeki breeki my friend.
